column1: Goodpasture syndrome is a rare disease that can involve quickly worsening kidney failure and lung disease.
Goodpasture syndrome is an autoimmune disorder.
People with this syndrome develop substances that attack a protein called collagen in the tiny air sacs in the lungs and the filtering units (glomeruli) of the kidneys.
The glomerular basement membrane is a part of the kidneys that helps filter waste and extra fluid from the blood.
Antiglomerular basement membrane antibodies are antibodies against this membrane.
Sometimes, this disorder is triggered by a viral respiratory infection or by breathing in hydrocarbon solvents.
The immune system's faulty response causes bleeding in the air sacs of the lungs and inflammation in the kidney's filtering units.
Men are 8 times more likely to be affected than women.
The disease most commonly occurs in early adulthood.
Loss of appetite, fatigue, and weakness are common early symptoms.

Lung symptoms may include: - Coughing up blood - Dry cough - Shortness of breath Kidney and other symptoms include: - Bloody urine - Burning sensation when urinating - Nausea and vomiting - Pale skin - Swelling (edema) in any area of the body, especially in the legs
The health care provider may hear abnormal heart and lung sounds when listening to the chest with a stethoscope.
